articles.description: Follow live text and radio commentary from the opening day of the 2024 Cheltenham Festival.
articles.title: Cheltenham Festival day one - radio & text

articles.description: England wing Immanuel Feyi-Waboso is ruled out of the Six Nations finale against France on Saturday because of concussion.
articles.title: England's Feyi-Waboso ruled out of Six Nations finale

articles.description: The politician who chairs the Culture, Media and Sport committee accuses Premier League clubs of making an "empty promise" about a new funding deal for the English Football League.
articles.title: Top-flight clubs accused of 'empty promise' on EFL funding

articles.description: State Man wins the Champion Hurdle as trainer Willie Mullins moves closer to the landmark of 100 Cheltenham Festival winners.
articles.title: Cheltenham Festival 2024: State Man wins Champion Hurdle for Willie Mullins

articles.description: Pace bowler James Anderson is excited to be part of England's plans in the summer but is not taking his place in the side as a given.
articles.title: I'm not getting any worse - Anderson

articles.description: Former Liverpool sporting director Michael Edwards is set to return to work for the club's Fenway Sports Group owners.
articles.title: Edwards set for key role with Liverpool owners FSG

articles.description: Australia all-rounder Ellyse Perry has become the first player to take a six-wicket haul in the Women's Premier League.
articles.title: Perry takes first six-wicket haul in WPL

articles.description: India wicketkeeper Rishabh Pant is declared fit to play in this month's Indian Premier League after a 14-month absence from cricket.
articles.title: Pant declared fit for IPL return after 2022 car crash

articles.description: Former Liverpool and Chelsea manager Rafael Benitez has been sacked by La Liga club Celta Vigo.
articles.title: Benitez sacked by La Liga strugglers Celta Vigo

articles.description: The World Anti-Doping Agency remains "deeply sceptical" about Russia's anti-doping practices, says president Witold Banka.
articles.title: World Anti-Doping Agency 'deeply sceptical' about Russia
